meanings.definition: A group of students meeting regularly to study a subject.
meanings.sent1: In math class, we learn about numbers and shapes.
meanings.sent2: The science class is in room 203 on the second floor.
meanings.sent3: During art class, we painted with our feet for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were like a master class in elegance.
meanings.sent5: The history class felt like a journey through time.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things with shared characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The upper class in society often has more privileges.
meanings.sent2: The working class includes people who do manual labor.
meanings.sent3: The class of superheroes all had unique powers.
meanings.sent4: Their team was a class of skilled professionals.
meanings.sent5: The class of birds in the forest sang harmoniously.

meanings.definition: A set or category of things having some property or attribute in common.
meanings.sent1: The luxury class of cars is known for its comfort.
meanings.sent2: The middle class forms a significant part of the population.
meanings.sent3: The class of desserts at the party was irresistible.
meanings.sent4: His collection included a class of rare stamps.
meanings.sent5: The class of flowers in the garden bloomed beautifully.

meanings.definition: A social stratum sharing basic economic, political, or cultural characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The ruling class made decisions for the country.
meanings.sent2: The lower class often struggles to make ends meet.
meanings.sent3: The class of artists showcased their talents at the event.
meanings.sent4: She belonged to a class of intellectuals who valued knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The class of musicians played in perfect harmony.
